column4: how can you erase "gksudo" rights for your session? say I did some work with it, then I want to discard my rights after I'm done, instead of wating for X minutes -- is there a command to do this?
what's the "sudo -k" equivalent with gksudo? "sudo -k" doesn't seem to affect the gnome prompt
not even if you run it from the alt-f2 dialog?
